div.l: But or we part · I wis · thow shalt be quyt
And therwith al · he lough and made chiere
And saide his tale · as ye shal after here
¶ Explicit prologus
A Prentice whilom dwelled · in oure citee
And of craft · a vitailler was he
Galliard he was · as goldfynche in the shawe
Broun̄ as a berie · a proper short felawe
With lokkes blake · I kempt ful fetisly
Dauncen he cowde ful wele · and Iolily
That he was clepid ꝐPerkyn reuelour
He was as ful of love · and paramour
As is the hyve · ful of hony swete
Wele was the wenche · with hym myght meet
At eủery bridale · wolde he syng and hoppe
He loved better the taủerne · than his maister shoppe
For whan any Ridyng · was thurgh chepe
Out of the shoppe · thider wold he lepe
Til that he had al the sight I sayne
And daunced wele · he wold nought com agayn
And gadred hym a meyne · of his sort
To hoppe and syng · and make suche disport
And thanne they setten steuene · for to mete
To play at the dise · in suche a strete
For in the toun̄ · nas ther no prentice
That fairer cowde cast a peyre of dise
Than ꝐPerkyn cowde · and therto he was free
